newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks mostly lower, some blue chips up.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks mostly lower, some blue chips up.

text.p: Croatian stocks closed mostly lower on Tuesday, with gains in some blue chip shares and losses among hoteliers.
* Of nine active issues, three were up, five down, while one remained flat.
* The volume was lower at 3,060 shares, but the turnover was up at 9.8 million kuna (Exchange rate: 5.4928 kuna = $1).
* The biggest gainer was fully listed drug firm Pliva, closing at 13,011 kuna, 111 kuna up from Friday, on volume of 616 shares.
* The biggest loser was Istrian hotelier Laguna Porec, which lost 101 kuna to close at 1,439 on 200 shares traded.
* The most actively traded stock was Zagrebacka Banka, which edged up 10 kuna to close at all-time high of 1,050 kuna on volume of 1,079 shares.
* Zagrebacka E-series shares were up 30 kuna, closing at 430.
